p.s: In the following text, I will express my opinion on the question whether the movie The Hate U Give changed my perspective on certain things or not.
From my point of view, I can clearly say that the movie did a great job at spreading awareness and visualizing the problem for everyone in the world to see.
Racism is a common problem many people see as annoying as it occurs more and more in the news and in conversations.
But it is clear that this is in the virtue of the people not being affected by racism.
I can say that I'm sadly also affected by daily racism and I too try to spread as much awareness on it as I can.
I can't really say that the movie changed my perspective of the problem but that doesn't mean it didn't change it for other people.

I fully support how the movie/director showed the systematic discriminating issue towards black people in the perspective of a young black girl who goes to school, has a family and is just trying to live a normal teenage life as white teenagers.
Thus I like the way the film slowly and easily educates on the problem for everyone to understand.
It shows the challenges a black teenage girl has to go through when other teenagers have it way more easy thenthan her.
Racism is still a problem and not only in America.
That's why I appreciate the often silenced topic that POCpeople of colour/black people are even discriminated by the government and nothing is done about it.
Considering every aspect I said, one can say that the movie is perfect for educating people all over the world and spreading awareness.
